meanings.definition: A sudden, brief, and intense storm with heavy rain
meanings.sent1: During the picnic, unexpected rainsqualls soaked everyone in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were caught off guard by the powerful rainsqualls at sea.
meanings.sent3: The outdoor wedding turned into a chaotic dance party due to the uninvited rainsqualls.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's anger burst out like a rainsquall, surprising the students.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling until the dark clouds signaled the arrival of the rainsqualls.

meanings.definition: To experience or be affected by rainsqualls
meanings.sent1: I hope we don't rainsqualls during our camping trip.
meanings.sent2: She always gets anxious when she rainsqualls on her way to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to rainsqualls whenever the vacuum cleaner was turned on.
meanings.sent4: His emotions rainsquall easily, making it hard to predict his reactions.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter rainsqualled through the house, bringing joy to all.
